snippet: Nothing about a largely rural area’s crimes has helped explain why two Kaufman County prosecutors were shot and killed in the span of eight weeks.
abstract: Officials in Kaufman County, Tex, have no answers as to why two county prosecutors have been fatally shot in span of eight weeks; there are no signs of link in murders of District Attorney Mike McLelland and his wife, and Assistant D A Mark Hasse weeks earlier, but killings do not seem random.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and SERGE F. KOVALESKI
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Kaufman, and Serge F. Kovaleski from Dallas. Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Nothing about a largely rural area’s crimes has helped explain why two Kaufman County prosecutors were shot and killed in the span of eight weeks.

headline.seo: Killings of 2 Texas Prosecutors in 8 Weeks Jolt Kaufman County
headline.main: Sprawling County in Texas Seeks Clues to Prosecutors’ Deaths
